posts.title: FDA Strengthens Dissolution Testing Requirements for Generic Drugs
posts.content:

  • Emphasis on Quality by Design (QbD) approaches

Raise Lab Equipment's dissolution testing systems are designed to meet these evolving regulatory requirements. Our instruments provide the precision, accuracy, and documentation capabilities needed for compliance with FDA standards.

posts.excerpt: United States Pharmacopeia releases revised Chapter 701 with updated specifications for tablet and capsule disintegration testing procedures.
posts.title: USP Updates Chapter 701 on Disintegration Testing Standards
posts.content:
The United States Pharmacopeia has published revisions to General Chapter 701 covering disintegration testing of tablets and capsules. These updates reflect advances in testing technology and harmonization efforts with international standards.

Key changes include:

  • Clarified apparatus specifications and tolerances
  • Updated guidance on disk usage for specific dosage forms
  • Harmonized language with European and Japanese pharmacopeias
  • New recommendations for testing modified-release products

Raise Lab Equipment's disintegration testers are fully compliant with the updated USP Chapter 701 requirements. Our instruments feature precision temperature control, accurate cycle timing, and robust construction to ensure reliable results.

We recommend all pharmaceutical laboratories review the updated chapter and verify their testing procedures align with current requirements. Our technical support team is available to assist with any questions regarding compliance.

posts.excerpt: Industry experts identify key trends shaping pharmaceutical quality control including automation, data integrity, and advanced analytics.
posts.title: Top Pharmaceutical Quality Control Trends to Watch in 2025
posts.content:
As we enter 2025, several key trends are shaping the future of pharmaceutical quality control. Understanding these trends helps laboratories prepare for evolving requirements and opportunities.

1. Increased Automation

Laboratories are adopting automated testing systems to improve efficiency, reduce human error, and enhance throughput. Automated dissolution testers, sample handling systems, and data management platforms are becoming standard.

2. Data Integrity Focus

21 CFR Part 11 compliance and data integrity remain top priorities. Instruments with built-in audit trails, electronic signatures, and secure data storage are essential.

3. Real-Time Release Testing

Process analytical technology (PAT) and real-time release strategies are gaining acceptance, requiring instruments capable of rapid, accurate measurements.

4. Sustainability

Laboratories are seeking equipment that reduces solvent consumption, energy use, and waste generation while maintaining testing quality.

Raise Lab Equipment continues to develop products aligned with these trends, helping our customers stay ahead of industry evolution.

posts.excerpt: Understanding the role of reliable testing equipment in achieving and maintaining WHO prequalification status for pharmaceutical manufacturers.
posts.title: WHO Prequalification: Why Quality Testing Equipment Matters
posts.content:
World Health Organization (WHO) prequalification is increasingly important for pharmaceutical manufacturers seeking to supply medications to international aid programs and global markets.

Quality control testing plays a critical role in WHO prequalification:

  • Dissolution Testing: Demonstrates drug release characteristics and bioequivalence
  • Physical Testing: Verifies tablet integrity through hardness, friability, and disintegration testing
  • Stability Studies: Confirms product quality throughout shelf life

Requirements for laboratory equipment include:

  • Compliance with international pharmacopeial standards (USP, EP, IP)
  • Proper calibration and validation documentation
  • Traceability to national/international standards
  • Adequate maintenance programs

Raise Lab Equipment manufactures testing instruments that meet WHO prequalification requirements. Our products are designed for reliability, accuracy, and compliance with international standards.

For manufacturers pursuing WHO prequalification, our technical team can provide guidance on equipment selection and qualification requirements.

posts.excerpt: Industry focus on particle size distribution highlights the importance of accurate sieve analysis equipment in pharmaceutical quality control.
posts.title: Particle Size Analysis: Critical Quality Attribute in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
posts.content:
Particle size distribution is increasingly recognized as a critical quality attribute (CQA) in pharmaceutical manufacturing, affecting drug dissolution, content uniformity, and product stability.

Applications where particle size matters:

  • Granulation: Granule size affects tablet compression and drug release
  • Blending: Particle size influences mixing uniformity and segregation
  • Capsule Filling: Powder flow and fill weight depend on particle characteristics
  • Coating: Surface area affects coating efficiency and uniformity

Sieve analysis remains the most widely used method for particle size determination in pharmaceutical applications. Electromagnetic sieve shakers like the RSS-1 provide superior accuracy and reproducibility compared to traditional mechanical systems.

Key advantages of electromagnetic sieve shakers:

  • Consistent, reproducible shaking motion
  • Adjustable amplitude for different materials
  • Low maintenance requirements
  • Quiet operation

Raise Lab Equipment's RSS-1 Electromagnetic Sieve Shaker is designed for pharmaceutical applications requiring precise particle size analysis.
